trans-unit.source: In this section, the elements of the Job Card are described.

seg-source.mrk: In this section, the elements of the Job Card are described.

trans-unit.source: The General FastTab contains basic information about the job, including the customer, job type and status, persons responsible and job links. The fields on this FastTab are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The General FastTab contains basic information about the job, including the customer, job type and status, persons responsible and job links.
The fields on this FastTab are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Unique identifier for the job. Depending on number series setup, this number can be generated automatically or entered manually.

seg-source.mrk: Depending on number series setup, this number can be generated automatically or entered manually.

trans-unit.source: Contact Company No. / Contact Company Name
Number and name of the contact company; used if the company requesting the service is not set up as a customer yet.

seg-source.mrk: Number and name of the contact company; used if the company requesting the service is not set up as a customer yet.

trans-unit.source: Contact Person No. / Contact Person Name
Number and name of the person requesting the service; used if the company requesting the service is not set up as a customer yet.

seg-source.mrk: Number and name of the person requesting the service; used if the company requesting the service is not set up as a customer yet.

trans-unit.source: Sell-to Customer No. / Sell-to Customer Name / Sell-to Address / Sell-to Post Code / Sell-to City

seg-source.mrk: / Sell-to Customer Name / Sell-to Address / Sell-to Post Code / Sell-to City

trans-unit.source: Number and address information of the customer; used if the company requesting the service is set up as a customer.

seg-source.mrk: Number and address information of the customer; used if the company requesting the service is set up as a customer.

trans-unit.source: The selection made here is independent of the selection made in the Company Contact and Person Contact fields.

seg-source.mrk: The selection made here is independent of the selection made in the Company Contact and Person Contact fields.

trans-unit.source: Informational document number that will be transferred from the job to the sales documents.

seg-source.mrk: Informational document number that will be transferred from the job to the sales documents.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the reason for which the Status has been set to Completed.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the reason for which the Status has been set to Completed.

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether this is a Main or Sub job:

seg-source.mrk: Indicates whether this is a Main or Sub job:

trans-unit.source: A Main job can have multiple Sub jobs.

seg-source.mrk: A Main job can have multiple Sub jobs.

trans-unit.source: A Sub job can have multiple Sub jobs and only one Main job.

seg-source.mrk: A Sub job can have multiple Sub jobs and only one Main job.

trans-unit.source: Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Job Hierarchical Structure.htm#_Ref381887744" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Job Card (Main and Sub Jobs)” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

seg-source.mrk: Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Job Hierarchical Structure.htm#_Ref381887744" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Job Card (Main and Sub Jobs)” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Displays the linked job number, if this is a Sub job.

seg-source.mrk: Displays the linked job number, if this is a Sub job.

trans-unit.source: Indicates that this job is an alternative to the Job No. assigned in this field. Alternative jobs can be created as a copy of an existing job using the “Copy Job” function, for example to calculate an alternative Budget Calculation.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates that this job is an alternative to the Job No.
Alternative jobs can be created as a copy of an existing job using the “Copy Job” function, for example to calculate an alternative Budget Calculation.

trans-unit.source: Displays the Version No. for this job, if multiple versions exist. The version can be locked by clicking Actions > Save Version.

seg-source.mrk: for this job, if multiple versions exist.
The version can be locked by clicking Actions > Save Version.

trans-unit.source: Identifies a Responsibility Center for the job.

seg-source.mrk: Identifies a Responsibility Center for the job.

trans-unit.source:
Determines where the sales invoice is sent.
Defaults to the Sell-to Customer No. selected on the General FastTab. This default can be changed if the Bill-to Customer is different than the Sell-to Customer.

seg-source.mrk: Determines where the sales invoice is sent.
Defaults to the Sell-to Customer No.
This default can be changed if the Bill-to Customer is different than the Sell-to Customer.

trans-unit.source: Identifies the contact number to whom the invoice is sent.

seg-source.mrk: Identifies the contact number to whom the invoice is sent.

trans-unit.source: Name, address and contact information of the selected Bill-to Customer/Contact No.

seg-source.mrk: Name, address and contact information of the selected Bill-to Customer/Contact No.

trans-unit.source: Alternate search name for the job.

seg-source.mrk: Alternate search name for the job.

trans-unit.source: Person or Resource to be associated with the job, typically intended for the sales and project manager. These individuals are automatically assigned to the Job Team.

seg-source.mrk: Person or Resource to be associated with the job, typically intended for the sales and project manager.
These individuals are automatically assigned to the Job Team.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the blocking status for actions related to the job. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the blocking status for actions related to the job.

trans-unit.source: Posting – Jobs can be used but are blocked for posting. Choosing this option means that no usage or sale can be posted on the job.

seg-source.mrk: Posting – Jobs can be used but are blocked for posting.
Choosing this option means that no usage or sale can be posted on the job.

trans-unit.source: All – All actions are blocked. That means no usage or sale can be posted on the job and the job no. cannot be entered in any document such as purchase order, time entry, inventory request, etc.

seg-source.mrk: That means no usage or sale can be posted on the job and the job no.
cannot be entered in any document such as purchase order, time entry, inventory request, etc.

trans-unit.source: Date on which the job was last modified.

seg-source.mrk: Date on which the job was last modified.

trans-unit.source: The Posting FastTab contains the information relevant for invoicing the job.

seg-source.mrk: The Posting FastTab contains the information relevant for invoicing the job.

trans-unit.source: The fields on this FastTab are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields on this FastTab are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the current phase of the job. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the current phase of the job.

trans-unit.source: Order – allows posting to the job

seg-source.mrk: Order – allows posting to the job

trans-unit.source: Completed – prevent posting to the job

seg-source.mrk: Completed – prevent posting to the job

trans-unit.source: Completed jobs are available from the cc|project menu by clicking History > Completed Jobs; these jobs are displayed in the Jobs list.

seg-source.mrk: Completed jobs are available from the cc|project menu by clicking History > Completed Jobs; these jobs are displayed in the Jobs list.

trans-unit.source: Determines which G/L accounts are used in posting processes.

seg-source.mrk: Determines which G/L accounts are used in posting processes.

trans-unit.source: The default setup in the Jobs Setup page is defaulted in, but can be changed.

seg-source.mrk: The default setup in the Jobs Setup page is defaulted in, but can be changed.

trans-unit.source: Inherited from the Customer and passed on to sales quotes and orders, but can be changed as needed.

seg-source.mrk: Inherited from the Customer and passed on to sales quotes and orders, but can be changed as needed.

trans-unit.source: Dimension information to be assigned to the job. This field is dynamic and will match the company’s selection for Global Dimension 1.

seg-source.mrk: Dimension information to be assigned to the job.
This field is dynamic and will match the company’s selection for Global Dimension 1.

trans-unit.source: Assigned to the job based on the Job Dimension (PROJECT) on the Job FastTab of the Jobs Setup page. The Autom. Job Dimension options are:

seg-source.mrk: Assigned to the job based on the Job Dimension (PROJECT) on the Job FastTab of the Jobs Setup page.

trans-unit.source: Job No. – Project code is created with the job number.

seg-source.mrk: – Project code is created with the job number.

trans-unit.source: Main Job No. – Project code from the main job is used.

seg-source.mrk: – Project code from the main job is used.

trans-unit.source: Dimension information to be assigned to the job. This field is dynamic and will match the company’s selection for Shortcut Dimension 3.

seg-source.mrk: Dimension information to be assigned to the job.
This field is dynamic and will match the company’s selection for Shortcut Dimension 3.

trans-unit.source: Dimension information to be assigned to the job. This field is dynamic and will match the company’s selection for Shortcut Dimension 4.

seg-source.mrk: Dimension information to be assigned to the job.
This field is dynamic and will match the company’s selection for Shortcut Dimension 4.

trans-unit.source: The fields on the Duration FastTab indicate the length of the job and creation date.

seg-source.mrk: The fields on the Duration FastTab indicate the length of the job and creation date.

trans-unit.source: Most of the information on the Planning FastTab defaults in from the settings specified on the Jobs Setup page.

seg-source.mrk: Most of the information on the Planning FastTab defaults in from the settings specified on the Jobs Setup page.

trans-unit.source: General planning date for procurement planning.

trans-unit.source: Currency is set up on the Foreign Trade FastTab.

seg-source.mrk: Currency is set up on the Foreign Trade FastTab.

trans-unit.source: Used for sales price finding for resources (services and traveling) based on job resource prices.

seg-source.mrk: Used for sales price finding for resources (services and traveling) based on job resource prices.

trans-unit.source: Statistical value for the job. Is automatically set to 100 if the job changes to Status = Open.

seg-source.mrk: Is automatically set to 100 if the job changes to Status = Open.

trans-unit.source: The fields on the Foreign Trade FastTab are used for job calculation in foreign currencies.

seg-source.mrk: The fields on the Foreign Trade FastTab are used for job calculation in foreign currencies.

trans-unit.source: The Invoice Currency Code field is used to define alternative currencies for sales (refer to topic “Calculation with Currencies” on page 1). The other fields are standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV; refer to Online Help for more information about these fields.

seg-source.mrk: The Invoice Currency Code field is used to define alternative currencies for sales (refer to topic “Calculation with Currencies” on page 1).
The other fields are standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV; refer to Online Help for more information about these fields.

trans-unit.source: The fields on the WIP and Recognition FastTab are used for the valuation of a job. The desired WIP Method and Realized % can be selected here; all other fields show calculated values from the various views. Refer to topic “Job Evaluation” on page 1 for more information about WIP processing.

seg-source.mrk: The fields on the WIP and Recognition FastTab are used for the valuation of a job.
The desired WIP Method and Realized % can be selected here; all other fields show calculated values from the various views.

Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Job Evaluation.htm#_Ref437537536" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Job Evaluation” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information about WIP processing.

trans-unit.source: : Job Card, WIP and Recognition FastTab

trans-unit.source: The fields on this FastTab are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Sum of the Calculation Total Price (LCY) fields for all lines in the Job WIP view.

trans-unit.source: Sum of the Calculation Total Cost (LCY) fields for all lines in the Job WIP view.

seg-source.mrk: Sum of the Calculation Total Cost (LCY) fields for all lines in the Job WIP view.

trans-unit.source: Transferred from released sales orders; used to calculate the WIP Amount.

seg-source.mrk: Automatically calculated value based on actual cost and budget cost.

trans-unit.source: That is a statistical value in this field.

seg-source.mrk: That is a statistical value in this field.

trans-unit.source: Difference between realized budget cost and the actual cost. Uses Realized % if unequal to zero or Realized % Based on cost.

seg-source.mrk: Difference between realized budget cost and the actual cost.
Uses Realized % if unequal to zero or Realized % Based on cost.

trans-unit.source: Sum of the Total Price Posted (LCY) fields for all lines in the Job WIP view.

trans-unit.source: Defaults from the Job FastTab of the Jobs Setup page.

seg-source.mrk: Defaults from the Job FastTab of the Jobs Setup page.

trans-unit.source: Determines how WIP is calculated using standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV logic. The options are:

trans-unit.source: Refer to Online Help for descriptions of these standard options.

trans-unit.source: Determines in which job WIP is calculated; works only with WIP Basis = Job.

seg-source.mrk: Determines in which job WIP is calculated; works only with WIP Basis = Job.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the last date on which WIP was calculated.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the last date on which WIP was calculated.

trans-unit.source: Displays the calculated WIP amount (in local currency) between the last and the current WIP date.

seg-source.mrk: Displays the calculated WIP amount (in local currency) between the last and the current WIP date.

trans-unit.source: Displays the calculated amount (in local currency) for pending losses between the last and the current WIP date.

seg-source.mrk: Displays the calculated amount (in local currency) for pending losses between the last and the current WIP date.

trans-unit.source: Displays the calculated amount (in local currency) for future expenses between the last and the current WIP date.

seg-source.mrk: Displays the calculated amount (in local currency) for future expenses between the last and the current WIP date.

trans-unit.source: Displays the calculated amount (in local currency) for revenue-based WIP (refer to the WIP Revenue-Based (LCY) field in the Job Line WIP Entries page).

trans-unit.source: Indicates if a calculated job value has not been posted (Finance).

seg-source.mrk: Indicates if a calculated job value has not been posted (Finance).

trans-unit.source: The Shipment FastTab contains contact shipping information for job related deliveries.

seg-source.mrk: The Shipment FastTab contains contact shipping information for job related deliveries.

trans-unit.source: The fields on this FastTab are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields on this FastTab are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Identifies a ship-to location for the job.

seg-source.mrk: Identifies a ship-to location for the job.

trans-unit.source: The Ship-to Address manages shipment addresses for customer-specific addresses of construction sites or other addresses. These are often job-specific addresses. Therefore, the Job No. and Main Job No. fields are also on the Ship-to Address.

seg-source.mrk: The Ship-to Address manages shipment addresses for customer-specific addresses of construction sites or other addresses.
fields are also on the Ship-to Address.

trans-unit.source: Identifies the person to whom the items related to this job should be shipped.

seg-source.mrk: Identifies the person to whom the items related to this job should be shipped.

trans-unit.source: Displays the name of the contact selected in the Shipment Contact No. field.

seg-source.mrk: Displays the name of the contact selected in the Shipment Contact No.

trans-unit.source: The Controlling FastTab displays all indicators of the job in one place. Indicators for instance are Order Value, Invoice Amount, Actual Cost, Expected Internal Cost, Purchase Commitments and the calculated Total Profit in percent and local currency. These values are also saved with a job version.

seg-source.mrk: The Controlling FastTab displays all indicators of the job in one place.
Indicators for instance are Order Value, Invoice Amount, Actual Cost, Expected Internal Cost, Purchase Commitments and the calculated Total Profit in percent and local currency.
These values are also saved with a job version.

trans-unit.source: The fields on this FastTab are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields on this FastTab are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the values of the released sales orders, in local currency.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the values of the released sales orders, in local currency.

trans-unit.source: This field also appears on the Jobs list page.

seg-source.mrk: This field also appears on the Jobs list page.

trans-unit.source: Indicates posted sales in the Job Ledger Entries, in local currency.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates posted sales in the Job Ledger Entries, in local currency.

trans-unit.source: This field also appears on the Jobs list page.

seg-source.mrk: This field also appears on the Jobs list page.

trans-unit.source: Indicates posted usage in the Job Ledger Entries, in local currency.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates posted usage in the Job Ledger Entries, in local currency.

seg-source.mrk: This field also appears on the Jobs list page.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the value of open entries in the Purchase Lines, in local currency.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the value of open Inventory Requests in the Job Journal, in local currency.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the value of open Inventory Requests in the Job Journal, in local currency.

trans-unit.source: Total profit value in local currency, calculated by Total Invoice Amount (LCY) - Actual Cost (LCY).

seg-source.mrk: Total profit value in local currency, calculated by Total Invoice Amount (LCY) - Actual Cost (LCY).

trans-unit.source: Total profit percentage calculated by Actual Total Profit (LCY) / Total Invoice Amount (LCY) * 100.

seg-source.mrk: Total profit percentage calculated by Actual Total Profit (LCY) / Total Invoice Amount (LCY) * 100.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the number of hours that have been budgeted for resources.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the number of hours that have been budgeted for resources.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the number of hours that have been posted to resources.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the number of hours that have been posted to resources.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the number of hours in the Job Journal that have not yet been posted to resources.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the number of hours in the Job Journal that have not yet been posted to resources.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the number of hours that have been scheduled for resources.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the number of hours that have been scheduled for resources.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the number of hours that have been released for resources.

trans-unit.source: Indicates posted invoices and receipts in the Customer Ledger Entries, as well as the outstanding amount and amount due, in local currency.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates posted invoices and receipts in the Customer Ledger Entries, as well as the outstanding amount and amount due, in local currency.

trans-unit.source: Payments and refunds are also calculated in the Amount Receipt (LCY) field.

seg-source.mrk: Payments and refunds are also calculated in the Amount Receipt (LCY) field.

trans-unit.source: Indicates posted invoices and receipts in the Vendor Ledger Entries, as well as the outstanding amount and amount due, in local currency.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates posted invoices and receipts in the Vendor Ledger Entries, as well as the outstanding amount and amount due, in local currency.

trans-unit.source: Payments and refunds are also calculated in the Amount Receipt (LCY) field.

seg-source.mrk: Payments and refunds are also calculated in the Amount Receipt (LCY) field.

trans-unit.source: The Navigate tab includes four action groups: Job, Views, MS Project, Prices and History. The actions within each group are described in this section.

seg-source.mrk: The Navigate tab includes four action groups: Job, Views, MS Project, Prices and History.
The actions within each group are described in this section.

trans-unit.source: This section describes the most relevant actions in the Job action group on the Navigate tab.

seg-source.mrk: This section describes the most relevant actions in the Job action group on the Navigate tab.

trans-unit.source: This action opens the Default Dimensions page, which displays the default dimensions assigned to this job.

seg-source.mrk: This action opens the Default Dimensions page, which displays the default dimensions assigned to this job.

trans-unit.source: This action opens the Job Comment Lines page, which is used to record unstructured data, such as user-specific comments. In addition, documents relating to the comment information can be attached using the standard Links functionality.

seg-source.mrk: This action opens the Job Comment Lines page, which is used to record unstructured data, such as user-specific comments.
In addition, documents relating to the comment information can be attached using the standard Links functionality.

trans-unit.source: Job Comments can be added to the Item Card, Service Card and Other Services Card. These comments will then be copied to the appropriate job view when the component is selected in the Job Budget Calculation view. The Comment Type field determines where the comment appears. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: Job Comments can be added to the Item Card, Service Card and Other Services Card.
These comments will then be copied to the appropriate job view when the component is selected in the Job Budget Calculation view.
The Comment Type field determines where the comment appears.

trans-unit.source: This action opens the Job Contacts page, which is used to assign additional contacts to the job.

seg-source.mrk: This action opens the Job Contacts page, which is used to assign additional contacts to the job.

trans-unit.source: Once added to the page, contacts can be moved by clicking Actions > Move > Up or Down for sorting the contacts.

seg-source.mrk: Once added to the page, contacts can be moved by clicking Actions > Move > Up or Down for sorting the contacts.

trans-unit.source: With this integration, all relevant functions within the application can be used for project management purposes, thus providing the ability to:

seg-source.mrk: With this integration, all relevant functions within the application can be used for project management purposes, thus providing the ability to:

trans-unit.source: Tie vendor billings to customer billings

seg-source.mrk: Tie vendor billings to customer billings

trans-unit.source:
Create “to-dos” and calendar appointments, including:
  • Planning deadlines
  • Task management
  • Documenting activity work breakdown structures
  • Integration with Microsoft® Outlook®
This action opens the Job Team page. The employees or resource groups assigned in this page are used later in the budgeting and planning stages.

seg-source.mrk: This action opens the Job Team page.
The employees or resource groups assigned in this page are used later in the budgeting and planning stages.

trans-unit.source: Since responsibilities are generally assigned to both the project and the job WBS positions, cc|project provides the following two fields on the Job Card:

seg-source.mrk: Since responsibilities are generally assigned to both the project and the job WBS positions, cc|project provides the following two fields on the Job Card:

trans-unit.source: The resources entered in these fields are automatically transferred to the Job Team with the resource assigned to the Person Responsible field identified as the Responsible individual. Additional team members can be assigned to the job by clicking Job Team on the ribbon.

seg-source.mrk: The resources entered in these fields are automatically transferred to the Job Team with the resource assigned to the Person Responsible field identified as the Responsible individual.
Additional team members can be assigned to the job by clicking Job Team on the ribbon.

trans-unit.source: Planning resources can be single persons as well as resource groups. Each can be added manually on the lines or by these functions on the Actions tab:

seg-source.mrk: Planning resources can be single persons as well as resource groups.
Each can be added manually on the lines or by these functions on the Actions tab:

trans-unit.source: Get new group members – Opens the Resource Groups page, from where all resources of the selected resource group can be added to the selected job team.

seg-source.mrk: Get new group members – Opens the Resource Groups page, from where all resources of the selected resource group can be added to the selected job team.

trans-unit.source: Person to job – Opens the Resource List page, from where resources can be added to the selected job team.

seg-source.mrk: Person to job – Opens the Resource List page, from where resources can be added to the selected job team.

trans-unit.source: Group to job – Opens the Resource Groups page, from where resource groups can be added to the selected job team.

seg-source.mrk: Group to job – Opens the Resource Groups page, from where resource groups can be added to the selected job team.

trans-unit.source: For more transparency of responsibilities and job assignments, the planning resources can be individually assigned to each job line or hierarchical level (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Capacity and Resource Planning.htm#_Ref383418531" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Capacity and Resource Planning” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: For more transparency of responsibilities and job assignments, the planning resources can be individually assigned to each job line or hierarchical level (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Capacity and Resource Planning.htm#_Ref383418531" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Capacity and Resource Planning” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: This action opens the Versions page, which displays non-editable copies of the job. Each new job is set as a first version.

seg-source.mrk: This action opens the Versions page, which displays non-editable copies of the job.
Each new job is set as a first version.

trans-unit.source: A new version can be created from the Job Card by clicking Actions > Save Version. In addition, each time the Job status changes, cc|project can be set up to ask whether the current version is to be saved.

seg-source.mrk: A new version can be created from the Job Card by clicking Actions > Save Version.
In addition, each time the Job status changes, cc|project can be set up to ask whether the current version is to be saved.

trans-unit.source: The Versions page can be accessed from the Job Card by either clicking Navigate > Versions or by clicking the value in the Current Version field on the General FastTab.

seg-source.mrk: The Versions page can be accessed from the Job Card by either clicking Navigate > Versions or by clicking the value in the Current Version field on the General FastTab.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon of the Versions page, click Project Card to open the Version Job card. The Version Job card contains most of the same information as the Job Card as of the moment the Version is created.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon of the Versions page, click Project Card to open the Version Job card.
The Version Job card contains most of the same information as the Job Card as of the moment the Version is created.

trans-unit.source: Click Budget Calculation to open the Version Job Budget Calculation page, which is similar in structure and style to the Job Budget Calculation. Additional fields in the Version Job Budget Calculation page can be used to compare the version Quantity, Total Cost Budget and Sales Line Amount Budget with the current values of the Budget Calculation.

seg-source.mrk: Click Budget Calculation to open the Version Job Budget Calculation page, which is similar in structure and style to the Job Budget Calculation.

Additional fields in the Version Job Budget Calculation page can be used to compare the version Quantity, Total Cost Budget and Sales Line Amount Budget with the current values of the Budget Calculation.

trans-unit.source: : Version Job Budget Calculation page, highlighting the version and current budget fields

seg-source.mrk: : Version Job Budget Calculation page, highlighting the version and current budget fields

trans-unit.source: As illustrated in <MadCap:xref href="#VersionJobBudgetCalc" class="Figure" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">Fig. 15</MadCap:xref>, the version quantity, cost and sales line amounts are different from the current values in the Job Budget Calculation in positions 1.1., 1.1.3., 1.2.2. and 1.2.2.4. The changed values are displayed in red italics to help quickly identify any differences between version and current budget values.

seg-source.mrk: As illustrated in <MadCap:xref href="#VersionJobBudgetCalc" class="Figure" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">Fig. 15</MadCap:xref>, the version quantity, cost and sales line amounts are different from the current values in the Job Budget Calculation in positions 1.1., 1.1.3., 1.2.2.
The changed values are displayed in red italics to help quickly identify any differences between version and current budget values.

trans-unit.source: This action opens the Job Milestones page, which displays all positions that have been set up as milestones.

seg-source.mrk: This action opens the Job Milestones page, which displays all positions that have been set up as milestones.

trans-unit.source: This action opens the Job Guarantee List page, which displays all guarantees relating to the job.

seg-source.mrk: This action opens the Job Guarantee List page, which displays all guarantees relating to the job.

trans-unit.source: This action opens the Job Documents page, which displays all documents relating to a job.

seg-source.mrk: This action opens the Job Documents page, which displays all documents relating to a job.

trans-unit.source: This action opens the QC Test List page, which displays QC Tests that have been assigned to the job.

seg-source.mrk: This action opens the QC Test List page, which displays QC Tests that have been assigned to the job.

trans-unit.source: This section briefly describes the actions in the Views group on the Navigate tab; each view is described in more detail in other sections.

seg-source.mrk: This section briefly describes the actions in the Views group on the Navigate tab; each view is described in more detail in other sections.

trans-unit.source: This action opens the Job Budget Calculation page, which is used to create the job structure and calculation, and is the basis for creating a job offer. Refer to topic “Calculation and Budgeting” on page 1 for more information.

seg-source.mrk: This action opens the Job Budget Calculation page, which is used to create the job structure and calculation, and is the basis for creating a job offer.

Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Calculation and Budgeting.htm#_Ref437875411" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Calculation and Budgeting” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

trans-unit.source: This action opens the Job Planning and Processing page, which focuses on all operative processes for planning, purchasing and project delivery. It is not possible to do a calculation here but all calculation-related fields can be displayed. Refer to topic “Job Processing” on page 1 for more information.

seg-source.mrk: This action opens the Job Planning and Processing page, which focuses on all operative processes for planning, purchasing and project delivery.
It is not possible to do a calculation here but all calculation-related fields can be displayed.
Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Job Processing.htm#_Ref437875424" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Job Processing” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

trans-unit.source: This action opens the Job Budget Sales page, which shows only sales positions that are associated with a Sales Code. This view is used to review and initialize invoicing. Refer to topic “Job Processing” on page 1 for more information.

seg-source.mrk: This action opens the Job Budget Sales page, which shows only sales positions that are associated with a Sales Code.
This view is used to review and initialize invoicing.
Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Job Processing.htm#_Ref437875451" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Job Processing” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

trans-unit.source: This action opens the Job Rolling Calculation page, which includes the most important sums during a job cycle. It is used for permanent job controlling.

seg-source.mrk: This action opens the Job Rolling Calculation page, which includes the most important sums during a job cycle.
It is used for permanent job controlling.

trans-unit.source: This action opens the Calculation List page, where a new calculation can be created or an existing calculation can be opened for the job (refer to topic “Calculation Schedule Templates” on page 1).

seg-source.mrk: This action opens the Calculation List page, where a new calculation can be created or an existing calculation can be opened for the job (refer to topic “Calculation Schedule Templates” on page 1).

trans-unit.source: This action opens the Job WIP page, which shows the information and batch operations necessary for project evaluation. Refer to topic “Job Evaluation” on page 1 for more information.

seg-source.mrk: This action opens the Job WIP page, which shows the information and batch operations necessary for project evaluation.
Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Job Evaluation.htm#_Ref437875352" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Job Evaluation” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

trans-unit.source: This section describes the actions in the Prices action group on the Navigate tab.

seg-source.mrk: This section describes the actions in the Prices action group on the Navigate tab.

trans-unit.source: This action opens the Job Resource Prices page, where job-specific pricing/discounts are defined for resources (persons or groups).

seg-source.mrk: This action opens the Job Resource Prices page, where job-specific pricing/discounts are defined for resources (persons or groups).

trans-unit.source: This action opens the Job Item Prices page, where job-specific pricing/discounts are defined for Items.

seg-source.mrk: This action opens the Job Item Prices page, where job-specific pricing/discounts are defined for Items.

trans-unit.source: This action opens the Job Charges page, where the following charges/discounts are defined for the job:

seg-source.mrk: This action opens the Job Charges page, where the following charges/discounts are defined for the job:

trans-unit.source: This action opens the Job Traveling Expenses page, where the job-related costs/prices are defined for travel expenses. Refer to topic “Traveling Expenses” on page 1 for more information.

seg-source.mrk: This action opens the Job Traveling Expenses page, where the job-related costs/prices are defined for travel expenses.

Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Traveling Expenses.htm#_Ref382228664" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Traveling Expenses” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

trans-unit.source: The actions in the MS Project group are used with the Microsoft Project integration. Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Microsoft Project Integration.htm#_Ref381296394" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Microsoft Project Integration” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information about setting up these actions.

seg-source.mrk: The actions in the MS Project group are used with the Microsoft Project integration.

Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Microsoft Project Integration.htm#_Ref381296394" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Microsoft Project Integration” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information about setting up these actions.

trans-unit.source: The History action group contains the Ledger Entries action.

seg-source.mrk: The History action group contains the Ledger Entries action.

trans-unit.source: Opens the Job Ledger Entries page, which is used to view all the ledger entries for a job. Posting to jobs always creates job ledger entries. The entries are either debits or credits depending on whether they increase your costs or represent sales to a customer.

seg-source.mrk: Opens the Job Ledger Entries page, which is used to view all the ledger entries for a job.
Posting to jobs always creates job ledger entries.
The entries are either debits or credits depending on whether they increase your costs or represent sales to a customer.

trans-unit.source: Job Journals and Purchase Receipts/Invoices/Credit Memos create Usage entries, Sales Invoices/Credit Memos create Sales entries, and Job Shipments create Job Shipment entries.

seg-source.mrk: Job Journals and Purchase Receipts/Invoices/Credit Memos create Usage entries, Sales Invoices/Credit Memos create Sales entries, and Job Shipments create Job Shipment entries.

trans-unit.source: The actions on the Actions tab on the Job Card are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The actions on the Actions tab on the Job Card are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Opens a message dialog, which asks the user if he/she wants to create a sub-job for the job (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Job Hierarchical Structure.htm#_Ref381887744" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Job Card (Main and Sub Jobs)” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Opens a message dialog, which asks the user if he/she wants to create a sub-job for the job (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Job Hierarchical Structure.htm#_Ref381887744" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Job Card (Main and Sub Jobs)” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: Opens the Copy Job dialog, which copies specific job information to a new job.

seg-source.mrk: Opens the Copy Job dialog, which copies specific job information to a new job.

trans-unit.source: Opens a message dialog, which asks the user if he/she wants to create a new version for the job (refer to section <MadCap:xref href="#Versions" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Versions” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Opens a message dialog, which asks the user if he/she wants to create a new version for the job (refer to section <MadCap:xref href="#Versions" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Versions” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: When this function is run, no description is added in the Versions page but one can be added manually.

seg-source.mrk: When this function is run, no description is added in the Versions page but one can be added manually.

trans-unit.source: Opens the QC Template List page, where new QC Templates can be created and assigned to the job by selecting the template and then clicking OK. The assigned QC Tests can be processed from the Job Card by clicking Navigate > QC Test List.

seg-source.mrk: Opens the QC Template List page, where new QC Templates can be created and assigned to the job by selecting the template and then clicking OK.
The assigned QC Tests can be processed from the Job Card by clicking Navigate > QC Test List.

trans-unit.source: The Job Card includes three cc|project-specific (or modified) FactBoxes:

seg-source.mrk: The Job Card includes three cc|project-specific (or modified) FactBoxes:

trans-unit.source: Job Comment Lines – displays all comments assigned to the job.

seg-source.mrk: Job Comment Lines – displays all comments assigned to the job.

trans-unit.source: Job Details - No. of Prices – displays the number of prices for resources, items and G/L accounts.

seg-source.mrk: of Prices – displays the number of prices for resources, items and G/L accounts.

trans-unit.source: Job Details - WIP/Recognition – displays actual price/cost for the job and WIP information.

seg-source.mrk: Job Details - WIP/Recognition – displays actual price/cost for the job and WIP information.
